title: Viegar wasn't nerfed to shit tier
body: He's quite good actually, they only removed his toxic aoe instant stun and made it activate slowly, they should do the same to annie <.<

replies.body: I played him the other day. He's still fun as all hell. I oneshot the enemy Ahri late game, but I disagree with what they did to his E. You have to rely on the enemy being stupid for it to land now. He never was "competetive" anyway. He's just a fungi.
Shortly before his changes went through, he was picked a few times competitively *just* for his stun (as a support).
Yea because {{champion:1}} totally isn't used as a support** solely **for her stun.
But those range nerfs made her instantly healthy to play against.  Kappa.

Don't get me started on support Annie... I've been against that from the start. She needs a lot more work than Veigar did, though (not that he doesn't still need work, but he's in a much better position now than he was).

In what way is he good again?

He has lackluster cc, no poke, minor wave clear. All he is now is an R button.

yes but when you're a point and click nuke mage with a stun so effective he was seeing play in the lcs in the support role just for the stun....over ACTUAL SUPPORTS he needed a change.
tbh veigar might need a total rework.

To be fair, I do agree that his stun needed to be tweaked, but thing is, Riot took away far too much power from him. It's pretty clear that they intended for his E to be used to trap the opponent in a small area and the stun is just there to incentive them not to touch the walls, but he also has no way to meaningfully take advantage of the fact that his opponents are now trapped inside a cage, since the cage is still big enough to manuever around his Q and his very slow W.

The problem is his E is an ultimate level ability in terms of power.  It segments off teams from eachother and its a 2.5 second stun.  Its an effective engage range of over 1000 units.  And it is on what becomes an 8ish second cool down.  When it was instant, there was nothing you could do against it.  I completely understand the need for it to be changed in the way it was.
Then his W needs to get more reliable. Because currently, agains a competent opponent, Veigar has a total of 2 spells: Q and ult.
I don't disagree with your statement.  A W buff would be good (though if it becomes more reliable, it would probably need a damage nerf somewhere).

did you read my post or do you assume that if some one doesn't say "X is weak after Nerf/rework/buff" then they're Meta sheep and don't understand how anything works?

The moment someone who was intended to play as an AP carry gets put in the support role JUST for one ability instead of some one who was designed to support their team, that is when there is a problem.

what you think i'm talking about is the stuff like quinn top need to be nerfed because they're not played in a specific lane/role when that is not true at all. Nautilus is now a great support even though he was played to be a jungler on release. 

Look at it this way. A professional player looked at veigar and realized that his E provided more reliable CC then champions like leona, thresh, nami, etc. He then picked veigar to support in a professional game and the E was so good that it out shined other supports who have an entire kit meant for CC.

You talk about 'point-and-click' nukes, yet say Veigar was picked to support for only one skill.  He has a reliable nuke that scales with your enemy's stats on his ult - that's a decent skill for a support to have.  I really don't see the difference between applauding when Nautilus (not designed to be a support) sees play at support, but calling for nerfs when Veigar does.  Btw, he was better at support when the game still had DFG, which was before Lemon played him in like 1 LCS game...

The fact that Veigar's stun outshone Leona/whoever's isn't really important because Veigar's everything else was weak enough that he wasn't OP.  I don't necessarily think it was a bad change to give the cage a warning, but Riot should've helped his W when they did, as that skill's sorta dependent on landing his cage.

And, oh yea, he lost his core item in all of this.  These nerfs, whether good or bad, are the opposite of 'compensation' Riot said he'd be getting.

and what you're completely overlooking is his 47% win rate pre "compensation" fact, even then he was still niche usage. even if players were still picking him solely for the stun and R rightclick on the enemy ap mid laner, he still came out behind from other traditional supports. 

dont say something is toxic just because you brazenly chose to build the same thing you build every single game, veigar swung both ways, either very useful, or free gold. 

whats that? banshees veil, merc treds, QSS, merc scimitar, rod of ages, health items, zhonyas, any bit of MR, sorry, nope, those things didnt negate a whole champion. 

the fact of the matter is that now hes dependent on his team to do anything, and cant 1v1, before he could SKILLFULLY place a sliver of a stun, and get a resulting kill, now he needs to follow up on someone elses CC to do anything. 

47% before, now over loaded Q spell to buff his win rate from 39% up to 47% again, his Q is all he has and thats all riot will buff because they think its a good spell, and THATS what gives veigar his identity as a Q farmer and ***NOT*** a bursty 1hko mage.

veigar cant lane, he cant trade, he cant cc, he cant farm under tower, he can only tower hug and Q farm. they turned him into nasus when old veigar was so much more.

and as always, veigar is still susceptible to poke, or dives, except moreso now that he cant stand behind minions to Q from the minion wave, he now has to stand off to the side if he wants to hit his opposing laner because minions block his Q.
Plus, his changes were up on the PBE around the same time he was getting picked, so unless Riot drafted up the changes the moment he got locked...

I mean, you arent wrong, but that is the way Riot has been balancing this game for a while now. Anyone remember when Zyra was a mid laner.

If a champ is good at multiple positions and happens to be op in one of those positions and ok in the other, steps to balance the champ in that position have usually made them sub par in the position they were balanced in.

You can argue until you are blue in the face about competency and what not, but that is the way things have played out.

The meta is what guides balance, whether you like it or not.

or karthus, all he is, is an r button too just with a powerful aoe that is like fiddlestick's ult, q that is spamable that just chunks the mid lanner's hp, oh and a massive wall that has a long stun that reduces mr and it will pretty much let you run from all bad situations if placed right

feel free to discuss his viable play style and what he accomplishes for the team, id love to hear all about the matchups hes strong in and what other champions give him a hard time. or better yet, feel free to give us an example match of you playing him and dominating with him, id love to see what you do.

I love {{champion:45}}  now. The new Q is quite decent and can be used to poke safely while simultaneously farming. You can easily reach 700 AP in almost every game, more if you go 100% AP. Personally I prefer movement speed AP items. I was utterly butt-destroyed by a Veigar with MS items as there was no way to run from his ult. I bought him and have had decent success with him since. 

The current e functions similarly to Bard's ult: it traps enemies in a target location for ensuing AOE wombocombos. You don't need to go for the stun; you just need to trap them and let the cavalry do it's job while you instagib a single target. Yes it's less OP than it was before but if you are currently using it trying to place the edge directly on top of someone you are doing it wrong. Just trap them and spam laugh.

someone explain.

Lolking -> Veigar - > Stats -> Master+ -> Monthly Average -> 31% win rate. -> >1% PICK RATE  #***BALANCED***

There are probably only one or two Veigar players in Master +. It isn't unlikely for all of him to be on tilt at the same time.

Better to take a look at Diamond statistics where the sample size is significant. Champion.gg gives statistics for Platinum +, which I think is the top 10%. http://champion.gg/champion/Veigar/Middle

In an isolated view, he's not bad.

Compared to every other midlaner he's trash.

Why play a mage that has bad laning, bad poke, two abilities that do nothing, mana problems if he even tries to use his two non-abilities, bad CC, sub-par damage until sometime around 40-50 minutes, and no mobility?

At least before he had reliable lane damage and CC. Then they removed two of his abilities and made the other one a skillshot and upped the CD.

Also, he isn't really as much fun to play because he only has a Q and an R now. You don't even have combos to entertain yourself, you just keep hitting Q praying that nobody notices you.

Veigar is definitely not shit tier, and he is healthier, but he's not "good". I like him and think he is playable now, but  for someone who now struggles to survive the laning phase even more than other late game champs ({{champion:67}} {{champion:75}} etc ) he doesn't have nearly as much reward. You can never carry a game with Veigar alone because he's only going to ever blow one person up at a time, and items like {{item:3157}}  and {{item:3140}} counter him fairly well.

Veigar is never the best pick, he's just not a troll pick anymore.

They made him boring as shit.

He's nowhere near as fun to play as he was.
People forget that the nerfs were meant to be compensation for the removal of dfg. We were told he was getting buffs for a nerf, when instead he got another nerf.

This is what they could have done with his E. Travel time. You get a timer that goes longer based on how far you put it. That way he can still use it defensively against champions like LeBlanc and Zed, while nerfing the offensive part of it. Simple fix as I generally will need that stun since I am slow and squishy.
Several people called for this, myself included.  Sadly, no such luck.  {{champion:238}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:238}}

Veigar was at one point nerfed to shit tier where the bulk of the complaints came from, he got buffed. No one is complaining about it anymore thus i fail to see the point in this thread however he is weaker then pre dfg removal still when he wasn't op to begin with so overall he took a nerf. honestly though i have no clue what riot was thinking making Q a skillshot
R would have been a much better ability to make a skillshot cause at least then the enemy about to take 1k+ damage feels like they can do something about it
as it is you hear that horrifying noise and then you take insane amounts of damage
and im saying this as somebody who used to love picking Veigar due to his ability to completely delete 2 champions from the game every teamfight if he got a good stun off
his W and E are in awkward places that used to fit well together, but now don't mesh well with eachother at all due to E no longer guaranteeing a W hit late game.

that being said I overall really don't like the slight Veigar rework but he is still pretty good. You just have to try harder to get less than you would have with him.
